dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5404 EH: Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to extend certain expiring provisions of law administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Short title; table of contents

subsection.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2014
.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. References to title 38, United States Code.
Sec. 3. Scoring of budgetary effects.
Title I—Extensions of Authority Relating to Health Care
Sec. 101. Extension of requirement to provide nursing home care to certain veterans with service-connected disabilities.
Sec. 102. Extension of authority for pilot program on counseling in retreat settings for women veterans newly separated from service in the Armed Forces.
Sec. 103. Extension of authority for pilot program on assistance for child care for certain veterans receiving health care.
Sec. 104. Extension of authority to make grants to veterans service organizations for transportation of highly rural veterans.
Sec. 105. Extension of requirement for report on activities of Department of Defense-Department of Veterans Affairs Interagency Program Office.
Sec. 106. Extension of authority for the performance of medical disabilities examinations by contract physicians.
Sec. 107. Extension of authority for collection of copayments for hospital care and nursing home care.
Sec. 108. Extension of authority for recovery from third parties of cost of care and services furnished to veterans with health-plan contracts for non-service-connected disability.
Title II—Extensions of Authority Relating to Homelessness
Sec. 201. Extension of current funding level for comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans.
Sec. 202. Extension of authority for homeless veterans reintegration programs.
Sec. 203. Extension of authority to provide referral and counseling services for certain veterans at risk of homelessness.
Sec. 204. Extension of authority for treatment and rehabilitation services for seriously mentally ill and homeless veterans.
Sec. 205. Extension of authority to provide housing assistance for homeless veterans.
Sec. 206. Extension of authority to provide financial assistance for supportive services for very low-income veteran families in permanent housing.
Sec. 207. Extension of authority for grant program for homeless veterans with special needs.
Sec. 208. Extension of authority for the Advisory Committee on Homeless Veterans.
Title III—Extensions of Authority Relating to Benefits
Sec. 301. Extension of authority for the Veterans’ Advisory Committee on Education.
Sec. 302. Extension of authority for calculating net value of real property at time of foreclosure.
Sec. 303. Extension of authority relating to vendee loans.
Title IV—Other Extensions of Authority and Other Matters
Sec. 401. Extension of authority to transport certain individuals to and from Department of Veterans Affairs facilities.
Sec. 402. Extension of authority for operation of the Department of Veterans Affairs regional office in Manila, the Republic of the Philippines.
Sec. 403. Extension of requirement to provide reports to Congress regarding equitable relief in the case of administrative error.
Sec. 404. Extension of authority for Advisory Committee on Minority Veterans.
Sec. 405. Extension of authority for temporary expansion of eligibility for specially adapted housing assistance for certain veterans with disabilities causing difficulty ambulating.
Sec. 406. Restoration of prior reporting fee multipliers.
Sec. 407. Extension of authority for agreement with National Academy of Sciences.
Sec. 408. Health professionals education debt reduction.
Sec. 409. Amendments to Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014.

section.header: References to title 38, United States Code
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of title 38, United States Code.

section.header: Scoring of budgetary effects
section.text: The budgetary effects of this Act, for the purpose of complying with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010, shall be determined by reference to the latest statement titled Budgetary Effects of PAYGO Legislation for this Act, submitted for printing in the Congressional Record by the Chairman of the House Budget Committee, provided that such statement has been submitted prior to the vote on passage.

title.header: Extensions of Authority Relating to Health Care

section.header: Extension of requirement to provide nursing home care to certain veterans with service-connected disabilities
section.text: Section 1710A(d) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for pilot program on counseling in retreat settings for women veterans newly separated from service in the Armed Forces

subsection.text:
Subsection (d) of section 203 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 ( Public Law 111–163 ; 124 Stat. 1143;
38 U.S.C. 1712A note) is amended to read as follows:
The authority to carry out a pilot program under this section shall terminate on December 31, 2015.

Subsection (f) of such section is amended by striking fiscal years 2010 and 2011 and inserting
fiscal years 2010, 2011, and 2015
.

section.header: Extension of authority for pilot program on assistance for child care for certain veterans receiving health care

subsection.text:
Subsection (e) of section 205 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 ( Public Law 111–163 ; 124 Stat. 1144;
38 U.S.C. 1710 note) is amended to read as follows:
The authority to carry out a pilot program under this section shall terminate on December 31, 2015.

Subsection (h) of such section is amended by striking 2014 and inserting
2015
.

section.header: Extension of authority to make grants to veterans service organizations for transportation of highly rural veterans
section.text:
Section 307(d) of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 ( Public Law 111–163 ; 124 Stat. 1154;
38 U.S.C. 1710 note) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting
2015
.

section.header: Extension of requirement for report on activities of Department of Defense-Department of Veterans Affairs Interagency Program Office
section.text:
Section 1635(h)(1) of the Wounded Warrior Act (title XVI of Public Law 110–181 ; 122 Stat. 460;
10 U.S.C. 1071 note) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for the performance of medical disabilities examinations by contract physicians
section.text:
Section 704(c) of the Veterans Benefits Act of 2003 ( Public Law 108–183 ;
38 U.S.C. 5101 note) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for collection of copayments for hospital care and nursing home care
section.text: Section 1710(f)(2)(B) is amended by striking September 30, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for recovery from third parties of cost of care and services furnished to veterans with health-plan contracts for non-service-connected disability
section.text: Section 1729(a)(2)(E) is amended by striking October 1, 2014 and inserting October 1, 2015.

title.header: Extensions of Authority Relating to Homelessness

section.header: Extension of current funding level for comprehensive service programs for homeless veterans
section.text:
Section 2013(7) is amended by striking $150,000,000 and inserting
$250,000,000
.

section.header: Extension of authority for homeless veterans reintegration programs
section.text:
Section 2021(e)(1)(F) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting
2015
.

section.header: Extension of authority to provide referral and counseling services for certain veterans at risk of homelessness

subsection.text: Subsection (d) of section 2023 is amended by striking September 30, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.
Subsection (c)(3) of such section is amended by striking enter into contracts and inserting make grants.

section.header: Extension of authority for treatment and rehabilitation services for seriously mentally ill and homeless veterans

subsection.text: Section 2031(b) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.
Section 2033(d) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority to provide housing assistance for homeless veterans
section.text: Section 2041(c) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority to provide financial assistance for supportive services for very low-income veteran families in permanent housing
section.text: Section 2044(e)(1)(E) is amended by striking fiscal years 2013 and 2014 and inserting fiscal years 2013 through 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for grant program for homeless veterans with special needs
section.text: Section 2061(d)(1) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for the Advisory Committee on Homeless Veterans
section.text: Section 2066(d) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

title.header: Extensions of Authority Relating to Benefits

section.header: Extension of authority for the Veterans’ Advisory Committee on Education
section.text: Section 3692(c) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for calculating net value of real property at time of foreclosure
section.text: Section 3732(c)(11) is amended by striking October 1, 2014 and inserting October 1, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority relating to vendee loans
section.text: Section 3733(a)(7) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking September 30, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking September 30, 2014, and inserting September 30, 2015,.

title.header: Other Extensions of Authority and Other Matters

section.header: Extension of authority to transport certain individuals to and from Department of Veterans Affairs facilities
section.text: Section 111A(a)(2) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for operation of the Department of Veterans Affairs regional office in Manila, the Republic of the Philippines
section.text: Section 315(b) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015.

section.header: Extension of requirement to provide reports to Congress regarding equitable relief in the case of administrative error
section.text: Section 503(c) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for Advisory Committee on Minority Veterans
section.text: Section 544(e) is amended by striking December 31, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Extension of authority for temporary expansion of eligibility for specially adapted housing assistance for certain veterans with disabilities causing difficulty ambulating
section.text: Section 2101(a)(4) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking September 30, 2014 and inserting September 30, 2015; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking fiscal year 2014 and inserting each of fiscal years 2014 and 2015.

section.header: Restoration of prior reporting fee multipliers
section.text: During the one-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the second sentence of section 3684(c) shall be applied—

paragraph.text: by substituting $9 for $12; and
by substituting $13 for $15.

section.header: Extension of authority for agreement with National Academy of Sciences
section.text:
Section 3(i) of the Agent Orange Act of 1991 ( Public Law 102–4 ; 105 Stat. 13;
38 U.S.C. 1116 note) is amended by striking October 1, 2014 and inserting December 31, 2015.

section.header: Health professionals education debt reduction
section.text: Section 7683 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (a) and inserting the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Education debt reduction payments under the Education Debt Reduction Program shall consist of—

paragraph.text: payments to individuals selected to participate in the program of principal and interest on loans described in section 7682(a)(2) of this title; or
payments for the principal and interest on such loans of such individuals to the holders of such loans.
in subsections (b) and (c), by striking payments to both places it appears and inserting payments to or for; and
in subsection (d)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking made to and inserting made to or for; and
in paragraph (2)(A), by striking payable to that and inserting payable to or for that.

section.header: Amendments to Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014

subsection.header: Expanded availability of hospital care and medical services
subsection.text:
Section 101 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1)(A), by inserting provide the veteran an appointment that exceeds the wait-time goals described in such subsection or before place such; and
in paragraph (2), by inserting (or other digital channel) after website;

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(1)(A), by adding at the end the following new sentences: An agreement entered into pursuant to this subparagraph may not be treated as a Federal contract for the acquisition of goods or services and is not subject to any provision of law governing Federal contracts for the acquisition of goods or services. Before entering into an agreement pursuant to this subparagraph, the Secretary shall, to the maximum extent practicable and consistent with the requirements of this section, furnish such care and services to such veterans under this section with such entities pursuant to sharing agreements, existing contracts entered into by the Secretary, or other processes available at medical facilities of the Department.;
in subsection (l)(1), by inserting a copy of before any medical record; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Section 501 of title 44, United States Code, shall not apply in carrying out this section.

subsection.header: Collaboration between VA and Indian Health Service
subsection.text:
Section 102 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish and inserting the following: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Director of the Indian Health Service shall jointly establish and implement;
in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

Entering into an agreement between the Department and the Indian Health Service described in paragraph (2)(A) with respect to the effect of such agreement on the priority access of any Indian to health care services provided through the Indian Health Service, the eligibility of any Indian to receive health services through the Indian Health Service, and the quality of health care services provided to any Indian through the Indian Health Service.
by striking subsection (d).

subsection.text:
Section 105 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking section 1315 and inserting part 1315;
in subsection (b)(2), by striking chapter 39 and inserting chapter 39 of title 31; and
in subsection (d), by striking required by subsection (b) and inserting required by subsection (c) .

subsection.header: Improvement of access to mobile vet centers
subsection.text:
Section 204 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting and readjustment counseling services after other health care; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (B), by inserting and events after locations; and
in subparagraph (C), by inserting and outreach contacts after appointments; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by inserting and readjustment counseling after telemedicine services; and
in clause (iii), by inserting and outreach contacts after appointments;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by inserting and readjustment counseling after health care services; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking mobile vet centers and.

subsection.text:
Section 206(b) of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking comprehensive database and inserting comprehensive, machine-readable data set;
in paragraph (3), by striking notice in the database of the reason and inserting notice of the reason; and
in paragraphs (2), (3), and (4), by striking database each place it appears and inserting data.

subsection.text:
Section 207 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of 2014 ( Public Law 113–146 ;
38 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended by striking successor database each place it appears and inserting successor data set.

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking Not later and all that follows through 2019 and inserting the following: On October 1 of each year beginning in 2015 and ending in 2019; and
in subparagraph (B)—

subparagraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking at each and all that follows through the period at the end and inserting the following: or guidelines of the Department with respect to determining the ratio of residents to staff supervising residents.; and
by striking clause (v) and inserting the following new clause:

clause.text: Efforts of the Department, as of the date of the submittal of the report, to recruit and retain medical residents to work for the Veterans Health Administration as full-time employees.

subsection.text:
Section 403(j) of the Veterans' Mental Health and Other Care Improvements Act of 2008 ( Public Law 110–387 ;
38 U.S.C. 1703 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking In carrying out and inserting Notwithstanding any provision of law relating to the use of competitive procedures in entering into contracts, in carrying out; and
by inserting under this section after make use of contracts entered into.

subsection.header: Clarification of approval of courses of education provided by public institutions of higher learning and in-State tuition rate for veterans
subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 3679(c) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter and subject to paragraphs (3) through (6), the Secretary shall disapprove a course of education provided by a public institution of higher learning if the institution charges tuition and fees for that course for covered individuals who are pursuing the course with educational assistance under chapter 30 or 33 of this title while living in the State in which the institution is located at a rate that is higher than the rate the institution charges for tuition and fees for that course for residents of the State in which the institution is located, regardless of the covered individual's State of residence.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives September 16, 2014.
